glsa.title: Apache: Exposure of protected directories
glsa.synopsis: A bug in the way Apache handles the Satisfy directive can lead to the exposure of protected directories to unauthorized users.

background.p: The Apache HTTP server is one of most popular web servers on the Internet.

description.p: A bug in the way Apache handles the Satisfy directive, which is used to require that certain conditions (client host, client authentication, etc) be met before access to a certain directory is granted, could allow the exposure of protected directories to unauthorized clients.

impact.p: Directories containing protected data could be exposed to all visitors to the webserver.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
